definition: incurable/incorrigible/beyond cure/hopeless
(negative prefix)/not/no
can/may/able to/to approve/to permit/to suit/(particle used for emphasis) certainly/very
see 可汗[ke4 han2]
to save/to assist/to rescue

sentences.english: Everyone makes mistakes, but few are incorrigible.
sentences.chinese: 人總是要犯錯誤的，但不可救藥的卻很少。

sentences.english: I believe he seriously thinks me an Philistine.
sentences.chinese: 我相信，他真的認爲我是個不可救藥的庸人。

sentences.english: I can figure this thing out, and it won't be that bad of a deal,' '' Talbot recalls thinking.
sentences.chinese: 我想我能夠做到，事情並沒有壞到不可救藥。

sentences.english: Ground of Yang Rui hopeless fell in love with clean workingwoman of Qing Chun to set one's mind at.
sentences.chinese: 楊瑞不可救藥地愛上了清純的清潔女工安心。

sentences.english: Most of them are incorrigible, and hated by others.
sentences.chinese: 他們多數是不可救藥的，而且憎恨他人。

sentences.english: His deep-rooted bad habits are simply beyond remedy.
sentences.chinese: 他的劣根性簡直不可救藥。

sentences.english: I really do believe there are some people who are just irredeemable.
sentences.chinese: 我也確實認爲有些人是不可救藥的。

bossy and domineering/throwing one's weight about
